definition: a matter for ridicule/an object of ridicule/laughingstock
handle or shaft (of an axe etc)/(of a flower, leaf or fruit) stem/sth that affords an advantage to an opponent/classifier for knives or blades

sentences.english: Once a league laughingstock, nobody even so much as smirks at the Hornets anymore.
sentences.chinese: 曾經聯盟的笑柄，沒人再去嘲笑蜜蜂了。

sentences.english: When you are weird, you are a joke.
sentences.chinese: 當你跟別人不一樣，你就會成爲笑柄。

sentences.english: Had he changed his mind, he would have become a laughing-stock.
sentences.chinese: 他如果改變了主意，可就成了大家的笑柄。

sentences.english: Du Jun soon became the laughingstock of all people in the store.
sentences.chinese: 杜軍很快就成了存裏所有人的笑柄。

sentences.english: This was insulting to Shelley and only likely to get me laughed at.
sentences.chinese: 這是對雪萊的侮辱，結果卻使我可能成爲笑柄。

sentences.english: It has become the laughingstock of the town.
His constant blunders made him the laughing-stock of the whole class.
sentences.chinese: 他總是出錯，成了全班的笑柄。

sentences.english: The audience burst into laughter at his reference to a people who are well-known raconteurs and often the butt of jokes.
sentences.chinese: 衆所周知，善談的愛爾蘭人經常被拿來當笑柄。

sentences.english: He did not get his hare but became a laughing stock in the state of Song.
sentences.chinese: 當然，兔子是沒等到，他自己卻成了宋國的笑柄。

sentences.english: The terrible king that couldn't even catch one mosquito was a laughingstock for his troops.
sentences.chinese: 國王不能抓到一個蚊子而成了他的軍隊的笑柄。

sentences.english: Tears and smiles all end up as laughing stocks.
sentences.chinese: 哭笑都是人們開心的笑柄。

sentences.english: 'I don't like terms that mock this trend, ' Mr. Guion says.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡這些讓潮流淪爲笑柄的詞彙。

sentences.english: This deification might make him the laughing stock of India…
sentences.chinese: 兒子的神化可能會讓他成爲印度的笑柄。

sentences.english: This young man bore the brunt of everyone's jokes.
sentences.chinese: 傻小子一向是衆人的笑柄。

sentences.english: He made himself the laughingstock of the town.
I am become a laughing-stock all the day, all scoff at me.
sentences.chinese: 我終日成爲笑柄，人都嘲笑我。

definition: lit. target of a multitude of arrows (idiom); the butt of public criticism/attacked on all sides
lit. for one's face to reach rock bottom/to be thoroughly discredited (idiom)
a pretext for gossip/a matter for derision
to spit on and curse/to revile
sth that people like to chat about/topic of idle conversation
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
to make a fool of oneself/to make oneself a laughing stock
leisure time (over a cup of tea, after a meal etc)
sb or sth detested by all/target of scorn/anathema/cf. 老鼠過街，人人喊打|老鼠过街，人人喊打[lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3]
